page.title: 15Farming
page.content: Agriculture plays an important role in the life of the Lune Valley. There are many farms situated along the valley and within our own area of study there are 15 farms. They are usually between 100-200 acres (40-80 hectares) in area. Dairy farming is the main form of agriculure although there is a growing influence in sheep and beef farming. This is due to recent EEC Agricultural policy which has led to a cut back in the size of dairy herds by as much as 10% There are fewer farms in the area than there were 25 years ago. This is due to the merging of some farms and the selling of some land for residential development. The climate of the area is such that there is about 30 cm of rainfall per annum above the optimum for arable farming to take place. The only crop grown is silage.
